resolution_description: "Translation" could revolutionize the sustainable harvesting of the dwindling scallop population in the Bay of Saint-Brieuc by developing an AI-driven linguistic platform that facilitates real-time cross-border collaboration among marine biologists, local fishermen, policymakers, and environmental activists, ensuring that innovative eco-friendly practices are communicated, adapted, and implemented swiftly across language barriers.

agreement_structure.current_goal: To maintain a sustainable population of sea scallops in local waters.
agreement_structure.current_action: Monitoring and managing the harvesting practices of sea scallops.
agreement_structure.imposed_goal: Increase the population of sea scallops by 25% over the next three years.
agreement_structure.imposed_action: Implement stricter regulations on harvesting quotas and introduce seasonal closures.
agreement_structure.mechanism: Establish a collaborative framework with local fisheries to ensure compliance and track population recovery.
agreement_structure.reasoning: The proposed resolution aligns with the desires of 'Морские гребешки' to survive and increase the population of sea scallops. By developing an adaptive marine habitat enhancement program, the scallops will have a direct influence on their environment, which can lead to a natural rebound in their population. Additionally, the introduction of stricter regulations on harvesting quotas and seasonal closures will mitigate the fear of over-exploitation and predation, ensuring a more sustainable and balanced ecosystem. This collaborative approach with local fisheries also enhances compliance and monitoring, ultimately supporting the long-term survival of the population.
